title: Rich List v Young Rich
text:
Rich Lister: Red wine for the heart

Young Rich: Microdosing

Life partner

Rich Lister: Life's too short for just one

Young Rich: Co-founder

Private club

Rich Lister: Melbourne Club, The Australian Club, The Hurlingham Club

Young Rich: The Battery in San Francisco, Miley Cyrus's tent at Burning Man

Passion project

Rich Lister: Rebuilding Notre-Dame cathedral

Young Rich: Solar farm in the Northern Territory, exporting electricity to Indonesia

Advertisement

Favourite holiday destinations

Rich Lister: The Med, Aspen

Young Rich: Nepal, Bhutan or anything with the promise of spiritual growth – because this is the first holiday you’ve had in three years

Designer label

Rich Lister: Zegna, Canali, Order of Australia pin, noticeably faded polo shirt for weekends

Young Rich: Patagonia, Kathmandu

Book

Rich Lister: The Art of War, Barbarians at the Gate, self-published family history

Young Rich: Sapiens, Outliers, Atlas Shrugged – although no one has read it

Lunch

Rich Lister: Beppi’s or Catalina in Sydney, Cecconi’s or France Soir in Melbourne

Young Rich: Al desko – or today’s special from the in-office kitchen, HelloFresh delivered to the office

Advertisement

Transport

Rich Lister: Gulfstream, Dassault Falcon, BMW 7 Series, VW Amarok for the farm, Tesla

Young Rich: Walk or pushie everywhere, ferry from harbourside property, Tesla

Guilty social media pleasure

Rich Lister: Selfies with Trump and other Rich Listers

Young Rich: Double-tapping Betoota Advocate, posting comments on TripAdvisor, but under a nom de plume

Favourite phrase

Rich Lister: “It’s better to wear out than rust out.”

Young Rich: “We’re not disrupting anything, because we actually don’t have competitors.”

Retirement plans

Rich Lister: 19th hole

Young Rich: Looking into cryotherapy

The November issue of AFR Magazine, including the Young Rich List, is out on Friday, October 25 inside The Australian Financial Review. Follow AFR Mag on Twitter and Instagram.
description: Rich Listers and their younger counterparts, are breeds unto themselves. We compare the habits, interests, hopes and dreams of the over 40s versus the under 40s ahead of the release of the 2019 Young Rich List.
